name: TheAtlantic
text: Although photographers took many pictures of people of color during the Great Depression, Sarah Boxer writes, the preeminent photographic record of the period left them out. https://t.co/3KhdAejc3n

name: TheAtlantic
text: The U.S. government has left a void in guidance about Thanksgiving this year. @jameshamblin clarifies why staying home is so important, as difficult as it may be: https://t.co/fLXLNGUkQD

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The lesson here is that the identitarian left must not labor under the impression that all Black and brown people share their sense of racism as an ultimate deal breaker," @JohnHMcWhorter writes: https://t.co/gEpbv70Q5v

name: TheAtlantic
text: When it comes to Queen Elizabeth II, “The Crown” tends to forgive easily. But in its sharp and splashy fourth season, the drama stops treating the monarch as a faultless heroine, writes @shirklesxp: https://t.co/dyJpQ8XWjO

name: TheAtlantic
text: Barack Obama is somehow still hopeful. Here are three key quotes from @JeffreyGoldberg's interview with the former president. The latest Atlantic Daily: https://t.co/TRQftUGgV7

text: RT @prashantrao: In Asia, Barack Obama left a complicated legacy. It is one that Joe Biden must now grapple with, @TMcLaughlin3 writes: https://t.co/NU739wr1sG

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YasmeenSerhan: “Celebrating Thanksgiving by entering someone’s home and spreading a lethal infectious disease is a little too darkly ironic anyway.”
https://t.co/fR7n66eU8m

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @AdamHSays: “The virus knows no difference between holidays and workdays. Our default should be to treat Thanksgiving as a day when the health guidelines are no different from any other day.”

A warning from @jameshamblin:
https://t.co/HlN39ykLfm

text: Every American's pandemic situation is different, but one basic rule could keep us all safer, @rachgutman writes. https://t.co/MCw8yE56w5

name: TheAtlantic
text: “I still feel bad. But you know what? I used that thing hundreds of times.” @jpinsk gets inside the heads of people who borrow things from friends and never return them: https://t.co/9jke61Yez9
